section.title: Import Collection
section.para: Documentary Collection is a method of payment used in international trade, whereby the exporter entrusts the handling of trade documents to banks and gives the banks instructions concerning the release of these documents to the importer.
The two most common conditions for release are:

listitem.para: Documents will be released only if the importer makes immediate payment according to the contracted agreement between the exporter and the importer. Also known as a sight Collection.
Documents will be released only if the importer accepts the accompanying draft, thereby incurring an obligation to pay at a specified future date. Also known as a term Collection.

section.para: module (IC) provides an interface for the drawee (the importer) to receive and follow up a Documentary Collection.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, "IC", "Import Collection" and "Import Documentary Collection" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the drawee and buyer and importer) to receive notification of Documentary Collections, and subsequent updates, from the Presenting/Collecting Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval or acceptance in the ongoing transaction flow.

section.title: Import Collection Landing Page
section.para: The Import Collection Landing page displays a list of ICs that are in various stages of an IC life cycle. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
The following image illustrates the Import Collection Landing page:

The following ribbon items enable you to perform various actions on individual LCs or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Draft
Lists all the ICs in draft state, you can Edit, View, Discard or view the history of events that Import Collection has gone through, through Details action.
Actions
Lists all the Import Collection transactions on which the bank has requested client action.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing Import Collection transactions that are awaiting client approval.
The Authorise action item is available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing Import Collection that are awaiting bank approval.
Outstanding
Lists all the Outstanding Import Collection records by the bank.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Import Collection records by the bank. The status given to such ICs is "Not Processed".
Closed
Lists all the Import Collection transactions that have been marked as purged by the Remitting Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Status, Drawee and Currency. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant ICs. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed ICs:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of ICs
CSV Download: Download the list of ICs displayed on the dashboard. Click on the Download icon to list the formats in which the files can be downloaded. You can download Current Data or Full Data.
Current Data: Downloads the transactions displayed on screen.
Full Data: Downloads all the transactions available under a particular status tab like Draft, Rejected and more.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed ICs.

section.para:
This section describes the information presented on clicking any of the following actions against any given transaction:
Details
Return
Approve

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the transaction details, all the events of transaction, attachments and charges associated with the transaction. The information is spread over three tabs 'Transaction Details', 'Events' and 'Additional Information'. Individual tabs are described below:
Click on Import Collection Landing button at the top of Details page to navigate back to Import Collection Landing page.
Click on Journey button at the top of Details page to view the history of events that the transaction has gone through.
Transaction Details: Displays the details of the transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab lists the fields based on the action you click against the transaction.
Events: Displays the history of events that transaction has gone through. The transactions are either acknowledged by the bank or a reporting event is initiated by bank that requires an action to be performed by a corporate user.
In case an action is pending on the corporate user, a Respond button is present against the stated event, that navigates user to screen to perform the respective action.
Additional Information: Lists the 'Attachments' added as part of this transaction and also displays 'Documents' and 'Fees and Charges' details.
